titleStmt.title: Lee Chambers et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6551

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Govener of Kentucky

The undersigned would respectfully represent that they as Jurors in the case of Comwt vs Thos Woodward. charged with the murder of Baker, found the said Woodward guilty of manslaughter and sentenced him to two Years confinement in the penitentiary. They state that the evidence was conflicting and they have since learned that said Woodward was industrious sober man, with a helpless family: and they pray your Excellency to pardon him: said Verdict was rendered in the 4th day of May 1865

Respectfully
Lee Chambers D C Jeff cir ct
W K Thomas J J C
E. L.

I James P Chambers Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court certify that the persons whose names are hereto signed were of the jury in case of Comwth vs Thos Woodward convicted of manslaughter at this term May 6 1865

Att J P Chambers
E. L. Stoll
Wm. K. Allan
foreman --
Wm. Grubb
R. W. Tompkins
Ch S. Robards
E L Dorsy
W S Conahey
Wm. Stevens
A Campbell
L A Bartels
N. Gwynn
